field.doc: A burst read (reading using the auto-increment) of 4 bytes starting at address 00, returns the manufacturing ID: "K" "i" "o" "n" in ascii codes "0x4B" "0x69" "0x6F" "0x6E"
A burst read (reading using the auto-increment) of 2 bytes starting at address 01, returns Who-Am-I value ("WAI") as the first byte (LSB) and a 2nd byte (MSB) that returns silicon specific ID.

register.doc: x - hp filter output.
register.name: XHP_L

register.doc: y - hp filter output
register.name: YHP_L

register.doc: z - hpfilteroutput
register.name: ZHP_L

register.doc: output register x
register.name: XOUT_L

register.doc: output register y
register.name: YOUT_L

register.doc: output register z
register.name: ZOUT_L

register.doc: 16bit pedometer step counter register
register.name: PED_STP_L

register.doc: The Command Test Response (COTR) register is used to verify proper integrated circuit functionality
register.name: COTR

field.doc: Command Test Response
field.name: DCSTR

register.doc: This register can be used for supplier recognition
register.name: WHO_AM_I

field.doc: WAI value for KX126
field.name: WAI

register.doc: The Tilt Status Current Position (TSCP) register reports the current tilt position.
register.name: TSCP

field.doc: LE - Left state X' negative (x-)
field.name: LE

field.doc: RI - Right state X' positive (x+)
field.name: RI

field.doc: DO - Down state Y' negative (y-)
field.name: DO

field.doc: UP - Up state Y' positive (y+)
field.name: UP

field.doc: FD - Face Down state Z negative (z-)
field.name: FD

field.doc: FU - Face Up Z positive (z+)
field.name: FU

register.doc: The Tilt Status Previous Position (TSPP) register reports previous tilt position.
register.name: TSPP

field.doc: LE - Left state X' negative (x-)
field.name: LE

field.doc: RI - Right state X' positive (x+)
field.name: RI

field.doc: DO - Down state Y' negative (y-)
field.name: DO

field.doc: UP - Up state Y' positive (y+)
field.name: UP

field.doc: FD - Face Down state Z negative (z-)
field.name: FD

field.doc: FU - Face Up Z positive (z+)
field.name: FU

register.doc: The Interrupt Source 1 (INS1) register contains 2 step counter interrupts and contains the Tap/Double-TapTM axis specific interrupts.
register.name: INS1

field.doc: STPOVI - Step counter Overflow interrupt
field.name: STPOVI

field.doc: STPWMI - Step counter Watermark Interrupt
field.name: STPWMI

field.doc: TLE - X' negative (x-)
field.name: TLE

field.doc: TRI - X' positive (x+)
field.name: TRI

field.doc: TDO - Y' negative (y-)
field.name: TDO

field.doc: TUP - Y' positive (y+)
field.name: TUP

field.doc: TFD - Z negative (z-)
field.name: TFD

field.doc: TFU - Z positive (z+)
field.name: TFU

register.doc: This Register tells witch function caused an interrupt.
register.name: INS2

field.doc: FFS - Freefall, 0=not in freefall state, 1=freefall is detected. FFS is released to 0 when INL is read.
field.name: FFS

field.doc: BFI - indicates buffer full interrupt. Automatically cleared when buffer is read.
field.name: BFI

field.doc: WMI - Watermark interrupt, bit is set to one when FIFO has filled up to the value stored in the sample bits.This bit is automatically cleared when FIFO/FILO is read and the content returns to a value below the value stored in the sample bits.
field.name: WMI

field.doc: DRDY - indicates that new acceleration data((00h,06h) to (00h,0Bh)) is available. This bit is cleared when acceleration data is read or the interrupt release register (INL (00h,17h)) is read. 0= new acceleration data not available, 1= new acceleration data available
field.name: DRDY

field.doc: TDTS(1,0) - status of tap/double tap, bit is released when interrupt latch release register (INL (00h,17h)) is read.
field.name: TDTS

field.doc: STPINCI - Step counter increment interrupt
field.name: STPINCI

field.doc: TPS - Tilt Position status. 0=state not changed, 1=state changed. TPS is released to 0 when INL is read.
field.name: TPS

register.doc: The Interrupt Source 3 (INS3) register reports the interrupt status of the Wake-Up and Back-to-Sleep functions, as well as the axis and direction of the Wake-Up detected motion.
register.name: INS3

field.doc: WUFS - Wake up, This bit is cleared when the interrupt source latch register (INL (00h,1Ah)) is read. 1=Motion has activated the interrupt, 0= No motion
field.name: WUFS

field.doc: BTS - Back to sleep interrupt
field.name: BTS

field.doc: XNWU - X' negative (x-)
field.name: XNWU

field.doc: XPWU - X' positive (x+)
field.name: XPWU

field.doc: YNWU - Y' negative (y-)
field.name: YNWU

field.doc: YPWU - Y' positive (y+)
field.name: YPWU

field.doc: ZNWU - Z negative (z-)
field.name: ZNWU

field.doc: ZPWU - Z positive (z+)
field.name: ZPWU

register.doc: The Status Register reports the status of whether the interrupt is present.
register.name: STAT

field.doc: INT - reports the combined (OR) interrupt information of all features. 0= no interrupt event, 1= interrupt event has occurred. When BFI and WMI in INS2 are 0, the INT bit is released to 0 when INL is read. If WMI or BFI is 1, INT bit remains at 1 until they are cleared
field.name: INT

field.doc: wake - reports the wake or sleep state, 0=sleep , 1=wake
field.name: WAKE

field.doc: Latched interrupt source information (INS1,INS2 except WMI/BFI and STAT when WMI/BFI is zero) is cleared and physical interrupt latched pin is changed to it's inactive state when this register is read. Read value is dummy.

register.doc: Control register 1. Read/write control register that controls the main feature set.
register.name: CNTL1

field.doc: PC1 - controls the operating mode. 0= stand-by mode, 1= operating mode.
field.name: PC1

field.doc: RES - enables full power mode
field.name: RES

field.doc: DRDYE - enables the reporting of the availability of new acceleration data ((00h,06h) to (00h,0Bh)) on the interrupt pin. 0= availability of new acceleration data not reflected on interrupt pin, 1= availability of new acceleration data reflected on interrupt pin.
field.name: DRDYE

field.doc: Gsel - Selectable g-range bits
field.name: GSEL

field.doc: TDTE - enables the Tap / Double Tap function. 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled.
field.name: TDTE

field.doc: PDE - enables Pedometer function
field.name: PDE

field.doc: TPE - enables the Tilt Position function. 0=disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TPE

register.doc: The Control 2 (CNTL2) register primarily controls tilt position state enabling.
register.name: CNTL2

field.doc: SRST - Soft Reset performs the POR routine. 0= no action. 1= start POR routine.
field.name: SRST

field.doc: COTC - Command test control. 0= no action, 1 sets AAh to STR @ 0Ch register, when STR register is read COTC is cleared and STR=55h.
field.name: COTC

field.doc: LEM - Tilt Left state mask
field.name: LEM

field.doc: RIM - Tilt Right state mask
field.name: RIM

field.doc: DOM - Tilt Down state mask
field.name: DOM

field.doc: UPM - Tilt Up state mask
field.name: UPM

field.doc: FDM - Tilt Face Down state mask
field.name: FDM

field.doc: FUM - Tilt Face Up state mask
field.name: FUM

register.doc: The Control 3 (CNTL3) register sets the output data rates for Tilt, Directional-TapTM, and the Motion Wake-Up digital engines.
register.name: CNTL3

field.doc: sets the output data rate for the Tilt Position function
field.name: OTP

field.doc: sets the output data rate for the Directional TapTM function
field.name: OTDT

field.doc: sets the output data rate for the general motion detection function and the high-pass filtered outputs
field.name: OWUF

register.doc: The Control 4 (CNTL4) register 4 provides more feature set control
register.name: CNTL4

field.doc: c_mode - Define debounce counter clear mode 0: clear 1: decrement
field.name: C_MODE

field.doc: th_mode: 0: absolute threshold 1: relative threshold (default)
field.name: TH_MODE

field.doc: WUFE - enables the Wake Up (motion detect) function that will detect a general motion event. 0= disabled, 1= enabled.
field.name: WUFE

field.doc: BTSE - enables the Back to sleep function
field.name: BTSE

field.doc: HPE - High-pass enable
field.name: HPE

field.doc: OBTS<2:0> - Back to sleep function output data rate
field.name: OBTS

register.doc: The Control 5 (CNTL5) register provides additional controls for wake-sleep engine
register.name: CNTL5

field.doc: The manual wake overwrite bit
field.name: MAN_WAKE

field.doc: The manual sleep overwrite bit
field.name: MAN_SLEEP

register.doc: The ODR Control (ODCNTL) register is responsible for configuring Output Data Rate (ODR) and low-pass filter settings.
register.name: ODCNTL

field.doc: IIR_BYPASS - IIR filter bypass mode for debugging averaging filter.
field.name: IIR_BYPASS

field.doc: LPRO - Low pass filter roll off control, 0=ODR/9, 1=ODR/2
field.name: LPRO

field.doc: OSA<3:0> - Acceleration Output data rate.* Low power mode available, all other data rates will default to full power mode.
field.name: OSA

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 1 (INC1) register controls the settings for the physical interrupt pin INT1, the Self-test function, and 3-wire SPI interface.
register.name: INC1

field.doc: Pulse interrupt 1 width configuration.
field.name: PW1

field.doc: IEN1 - Enable/disable physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: IEN1

field.doc: IEA1 - Interrupt active level control for interrupt pin 1, 0=active low, 1=active high.
field.name: IEA1

field.doc: IEL1 - Interrupt latch control for interrupt pin 1, 0=latched, 1=one pulse
field.name: IEL1

field.doc: STPOL - ST polarity, This bit is ignored when STNULL is set.
field.name: STPOL

field.doc: SPI3E - 3-wired SPI interface, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: SPI3E

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 2 (INC2) register controls which axis and direction of detected motion can cause an interrupt.
register.name: INC2

field.doc: AOI - And-Or configuration, 0=Or combination of selected directions, 1=And combination of selected axes
field.name: AOI

field.doc: XNWUE - x negative (x-) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: XNWUE

field.doc: XPWUE - x positive (x+) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: XPWUE

field.doc: YNWUE - y negative (y-) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: YNWUE

field.doc: YPWUE - y positive (y+) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: YPWUE

field.doc: ZNWUE - z negative (z-) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: ZNWUE

field.doc: ZPWUE - z positive (z+) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: ZPWUE

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 3 (INC3) register controls which axis and direction of Tap/Double-TapTM can cause an interrupt.
register.name: INC3

field.doc: enables/disables alternate tap masking scheme
field.name: TMEN

field.doc: x negative (x-): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TLEM

field.doc: x positive (x+): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TRIM

field.doc: y negative (y-): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TDOM

field.doc: y positive (y+): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TUPM

field.doc: z negative (z-): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TFDM

field.doc: z positive (z+): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TFUM

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 4 (INC4) register controls routing of an interrupt reporting to physical interrupt pin INT1.
register.name: INC4

field.doc: FFI1 - Freefall interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: FFI1

field.doc: BFI1 - Buffer full interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: BFI1

field.doc: WMI1 - Watermark interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: WMI1

field.doc: DRDYI1 - Data ready interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: DRDYI1

field.doc: BTSI1 - Back to sleep interrupt reported in interrupt pin 1
field.name: BTSI1

field.doc: TDTI1 - Tap/Double Tap interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: TDTI1

field.doc: WUFI1 - Wake Up (motion detect) interrupt reported pn physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: WUFI1

field.doc: TPI1 - Tilt position interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: TPI1

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 5 (INC5) register controls the settings for the physical interrupt pin INT2.
register.name: INC5

field.doc: PW2 - Pulse interrupt width on INT2
field.name: PW2

field.doc: IEN2 - Enable/disable physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: IEN2

field.doc: IEA2 - Interrupt active level control for interrupt pin 2, 0=active low, 1=active high.
field.name: IEA2

field.doc: IEL2 - Interrupt latch control for interrupt pin 2, 0=latched, 1=one pulse
field.name: IEL2

field.doc: ACLR2 - Auto interrupt clear(same as INL) for the following event, only available in pulse interrupt mode, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: ACLR2

field.doc: ACLR1 - Auto interrupt clear(same as INL) for the following event, only available in pulse interrupt mode, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: ACLR1

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 6 (INC6) register controls routing of interrupt reporting to physical interrupt pin INT2.
register.name: INC6

field.doc: FFI2 - Freefall interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: FFI2

field.doc: BFI2 - Buffer full interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: BFI2

field.doc: WMI2 - Watermark interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: WMI2

field.doc: DRDYI2 - Data ready interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: DRDYI2

field.doc: BTSI2 - Back to sleep interrupt reported in interrupt pin 2
field.name: BTSI2

field.doc: TDTI2 - Tap/Double Tap interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: TDTI2

field.doc: WUFI2 - Wake Up (motion detect) interrupt reported pn physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: WUFI2

field.doc: TPI2 - Tilt position interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN2=1).
field.name: TPI2

register.doc: The Interrupt Control 7 (INC7) register controls the pedometer (step counter) engine.
register.name: INC7

field.doc: STPOVI2 - Step counter overflow interrupt on interrupt pin 2
field.name: STPOVI2

field.doc: STPWMI2 - Step counter watermark interrupt on interrupt pin 2
field.name: STPWMI2

field.doc: STPINCI2 - Step counter increment interrupt on interrupt pin 2
field.name: STPINCI2

field.doc: STPOVI1 - Step counter overflow interrupt on interrupt pin 1
field.name: STPOVI1

field.doc: STPWMI1 - Step counter watermark interrupt on interrupt pin 1
field.name: STPWMI1

field.doc: STPINCI1 - Step counter increment interrupt on interrupt pin 1
field.name: STPINCI1

field.doc: Tilt Position State Timer. This register is the initial count register for Tilt Position State timer. (0 to 255). New state must be valid as many measurement periods before change is accepted. Reset applied for any write to TSC with TPE enabled
field.name: TSC

register.doc: The Tap/Double-TapTM Report Control (TDTRC) register is responsible for enabling/disabling reporting of Tap/Double-TapTM events.
register.name: TDTRC

field.doc: DTRE - Double tap report Enable. When DTRE is set to 1, update INS1 and DTDS in INS2 with double tap events. When DTRE is set to 0, do not update INS1 or DTDS if double tap occurs.
field.name: DTRE

field.doc: STRE - Single tap report Enable. When STRE is set to 1, update INS1 and DTDS in INS2 single tap events. When DTRE is set to 0, do not update INS1 or DTDS if single tap occurs.
field.name: STRE

field.doc: The Tap/Double-TapTM Counter (TDTC) register contains counter information for the detection of a double tap event.
field.name: TDTC

field.doc: The Tap Threshold High (TTH) register represents the 8-bit jerk high threshold to determine if a tap is detected.
field.name: TTH

field.doc: The Tap Threshold Low (TTL) register represents the 8-bit (0– 255) jerk low threshold to determine if a tap is detected.
field.name: TTL

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of any tap event.
field.name: FTD

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of a double tap event.
field.name: STD

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of a tap event.
field.name: TLT

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of single and double taps.
field.name: TWS

field.doc: The Free Fall Threshold (FFTH) register contains the threshold of the Free fall detection.
field.name: FFTH

field.doc: The Free Fall Counter (FFC) register contains the counter setting of the Free fall detection.
field.name: FFC

register.doc: The Free Fall Control (FFCNTL) register contains the control setting of the Free fall detection.
register.name: FFCNTL

field.doc: FFIE - Freefall engine enable, 0=disabled, 1=enabled.
field.name: FFIE

field.doc: ULMODE - Interrupt latch/un-latch control, 0=latched, 1=unlatched.
field.name: ULMODE

field.doc: DCRM - Debounce methodology control, 0=count up/down, 1=count up/reset.
field.name: DCRM

field.doc: OFFI<2:0> - Freefall function output data rate
field.name: OFFI

field.doc: Tilt Angle Low Limit: This register sets the low-level threshold for tilt angle detection.
field.name: LL

field.doc: Tilt Angle High Limit: This register sets the high-level threshold for tilt angle detection.
field.name: HL

field.doc: This register sets the Hysteresis that is placed in between the Screen Rotation states.
field.name: HYST

register.doc: Low Power Control
register.name: LP_CNTL

field.doc: Averaging Filter Control
field.name: AVC

register.doc: Wake-up Function Threshold (WUFTH), Back-to-Sleep and Wake-Up Function Threshold (BTSWUFTH), and Back-to-Sleep Threshold (BTSTH) registers set the thresholds for Wake-up and Back-to-Sleep engines.
register.name: WUFTH

field.doc: lsb part of WUF threshold
field.name: WUFTH_L

register.doc: Wake-up Function Threshold (WUFTH), Back-to-Sleep and Wake-Up Function Threshold (BTSWUFTH), and Back-to-Sleep Threshold (BTSTH) registers set the thresholds for Wake-up and Back-to-Sleep engines.
register.name: BTSWUFTH

field.doc: msb part of BTS threshold
field.name: BTSTH8_10

field.doc: msb part of WUF threshold
field.name: WUFTH8_10

register.doc: Wake-up Function Threshold (WUFTH), Back-to-Sleep and Wake-Up Function Threshold (BTSWUFTH), and Back-to-Sleep Threshold (BTSTH) registers set the thresholds for Wake-up and Back-to-Sleep engines.
register.name: BTSTH

field.doc: lsb part of BTS threshold
field.name: BTSTH_L

field.doc: This register is the initial count register for the BTS motion detection timer (0 to 255 counts)
field.name: BTSC

field.doc: The Wake-Up Function Counter (WUFC) is the initial count register for the motion detection timer (0 to 255 counts)
field.name: WUFC

field.doc: Pedometer Step Counter Watermark Low and High registers set the 16-bit count value used as a watermark threshold for step counting.
field.name: PED_STPWM_L

register.doc: Pedometer Control register 1 (PED_CNTL1). The setting of this register is affected by pedometer engine ODR selection.
register.name: PED_CNTL1

field.doc: STP_TH<2:0> ; A threshold for discarding counting if not enough steps coming. Values: 0, 1, ..., 7. -> 0, 1, 2, 4, ..., 15. Reset applied for any write to PED_CNTL1 with PDE enabled
field.name: STP_TH

item.doc: No threshold count for start counting
item.name: no_step

field.doc: MAG_SCALE<3:0>. Scaling factor for the input signal (x,y,z). Bit shift. Values: 16 bit data, 6; 12 bit data, 1; Reset applied for any write to PED_CNTL1 with PDE enabled
field.name: MAG_SCALE

register.doc: Pedometer control register 2.
register.name: PED_CNTL2

field.doc: hps = 3. Scaling factor for the output from the high-pass filter. Bit shift operation. Values: 0, 1, ..., 7. -> 1, 2, ..., 128. Reset applied for any write to PED_CNTL2 with PDE enabled
field.name: HPS

field.doc: The length of the low-pass filter (as ODR 50 or 100Hz)
field.name: PED_ODR

register.doc: Pedometer Control register 3 (PED_CNTL3).
register.name: PED_CNTL3

field.doc: Scaling factor inside high-pass filter
field.name: FCB

field.doc: Scaling factor inside high-pass filter
field.name: FCA

register.doc: Pedometer Control register 4 (PED_CNTL4).
register.name: PED_CNTL4

field.doc: B_CNT<2:0> below_count[2:0] = 2; Samples below the zero threshold before setting e.g. Area == 0. Originally this was 0 samples. Values: 0, 1, ..., 7. -> 0, 2, 4, ..., 14. Reset applied for any write to PED_CNTL4 with PDE enabled
field.name: B_CNT

field.doc: A_h = 15; // Maximum area of the peak (maximum impact from the floor). Values: 0, 1, ..., 15: with Ah_fc -> 0, 1024, ..., 15360. Reset applied for any write to PED_CNTL4 with PDE enabled
field.name: A_H

field.doc: Pedometer Control register 5 (PED_CNTL5). The setting of this register is affected by pedometer engine ODR selection.
field.name: A_L

register.doc: Pedometer Control register 6 (PED_CNTL6). The setting of this register is affected by pedometer engine ODR selection.
register.name: PED_CNTL6

field.doc: Maximum time interval for the peak
field.name: M_H5

field.doc: Pedometer Control register 7 (PED_CNTL7).
field.name: M_L

field.doc: Pedometer Control register 8 (PED_CNTL8). The setting of this register is affected by pedometer engine ODR selection.
field.name: T_L

field.doc: Pedometer Control register 9 (PED_CNTL9). The setting of this register is affected by pedometer engine ODR selection.
field.name: T_M

field.doc: Pedometer Control register 10 (PED_CNTL10). The setting of this register is affected by pedometer engine ODR selection.
field.name: T_P

register.doc: Self test initiation
register.name: SELF_TEST

field.doc: When 0xCA is written to this register, the MEMS self-test function is enabled. Electrostatic-actuation of the accelerometer, results in a DC shift of the X, Y and Z axis outputs. Writing 0x00 to this register will return the accelerometer to normal operation
field.name: MEMS_TEST

register.doc: The Buffer Control 1 (BUF_CNTL1) register controls the buffer sample threshold
register.name: BUF_CNTL1

field.doc: buffer sample control threshold lsb
field.name: SMP_TH8

register.doc: The Buffer Control 2 (BUF_CNTL2) register controls sample buffer operation
register.name: BUF_CNTL2

field.doc: controls activation of the sample buffer
field.name: BUFE

field.doc: determines the resolution of the acceleration data samples collected by the sample
field.name: BRES

field.doc: buffer full interrupt enable bit
field.name: BFIE

field.doc: buffer sample control threshold msb
field.name: SMP_TH8_9

field.doc: selects the operating mode of the sample buffer
field.name: BUF_BM

item.doc: The buffer collects 681 sets of 8-bit low resolution values or 339 sets of 16-bit high resolution values and then stops collecting data, collecting new data only when the buffer is not full
item.name: FIFO

item.doc: The buffer holds the last 681 sets of 8-bit low resolution values or 339 sets of 16-bit high resolution values. Once the buffer is full, the oldest data is discarded to make room for newer data.
item.name: STREAM

item.doc: When a trigger event occurs, the buffer holds the last data set of SMP[9:0] samples before the trigger event and then continues to collect data until full. New data is collected only when the buffer is not full.
item.name: TRIGGER

item.doc: The buffer holds the last 681 sets of 8-bit low resolution values or 339 sets of 16-bit high resolution values. Once the buffer is full, the oldest data is discarded to make room for newer data. Reading from the buffer in this mode will return the most recent data first.
item.name: FILO

register.doc: Buffer Status: These register reports the status of the sample buffer.
register.name: BUF_STATUS_1

field.doc: buffer sample status level lsb

register.doc: Buffer Status: These register reports the status of the sample buffer.
register.name: BUF_STATUS_2

field.doc: reports the status of the buffer’s trigger function if this mode has been selected
field.name: BUF_TRIG

field.doc: buffer sample status level msb
field.name: SMP_LEV8_11

field.doc: Latched buffer status information and the entire sample buffer are cleared when any data is written to this register.
Buffer output register

register.doc: This register can be used for supplier recognition
register.name: WHO_AM_I
